snippet: Mixed doubles matches, which feature few recognizable names, rarely draw large crowds and are played only at Grand Slam and Olympic tournaments.
abstract: Mixed doubles in tennis is a rare, coed professional sporting event that pits one male-female team against another; it is played only at Grand Slam and Olympic tournaments and may be to tennis what the race walk is to track and field, an overlooked event that even the most impassioned fans and athletes seldom get behind; most fans never know the winners even at the United States Open.
lead_paragraph: Mixed doubles matches, which feature few recognizable names, rarely draw large crowds and are played only at Grand Slam and Olympic tournaments.

headline.main: For Coed U.S. Open Event, Reaction Seems to Be Mixed, Too
headline.print_headline: For Coed Grand Slam Event, Reaction Seems to Be Mixed, Too
